result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis W Bowens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court Ordered Defendant Provide a DNA sample.
*Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 8-11-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court Ordered Defendant Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 8-11-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Travis W Bowens in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Travis W Bowens in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial and motion hearing, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 08/22/16 is vacated.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court, defendant Travis W Bowens not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing and final pre-trial, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travis W Bowens in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Travis W Bowens in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for motion hearing.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Sworn for the state: James Hunter, City of Milwaukee Police Offer.  Exhibits 1-5, 7-8 received.  Exhibit list received and filed. For reasons stated on the record State requested a continuation of the Motion Heairng granted by the court. State to Supboena Officer Guthrie.  Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Motion to Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence, received and filed.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court, defendant Travis W Bowens not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense requests motion hearing date.  Defense received today, state's reply due 05/04/2016.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Suppress received and filed.

Defendant Travis W Bowens in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Travis W Bowens in custody. Nicholas Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: James Hunter, Milwaukee County Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous  weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Travis W Bowens in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Travis W Bowens in custody.  Mark Patrick Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Travis W Bowens
Current: 2027 N 23rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 02-25-2016)
Prior: 3053 N. 76th Street #3, Milwaukee, WI 53222
Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred to the Honorable Timothy Witkowiak.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for initial appearance. 

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.

Defendant Travis W Bowens in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Cherella was here with his client. Case was rescheduled for 6-17-2015, at 1:30 pm. Per ADA Nathaniel Adamson.
  Initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
